column4: i have a question, can a USB flash drive that's formatted as FAT32 be read in Ubuntu?
how do i get ubuntu to see my usb flash drive?
ok, THX-1138, i'll try that
sudo mount -a doesnt seem to work, my flash drive isnt coming on
i have question, i installed a Synthesizer that uses jACK, but i dont know how to install jACK, and the Synthesizer needs it to run, what do i do?
i think my ubuntu uses ALSA or something
start jacks?
what should i select in the package manager when installing jACK so that it will be seen?
I believe the package's name is jackd
yeah i installed it, but the server never runs
RoseGarden's preferences tell me how, I think. I'm looking it up.
I think jack is a CD ripper or somesuch.
try jackstart -d alsa
hm. Works for me. Type jackstart and look at the options for the '-d' option. Try oss, but that will prevent all other applications from using sound.
you have an esd driver available? Use that then.
I don't know. :(   ...I remember seeing that error, but not how I dealt with it.
yeah, ignore that. mine says that too, even when it works. I think it needs to run as root to get special priveleges for that.
sure. Linux has buffer exploits too...
say whah!
ah
it asks ubotu to private msg you information about the topic named by !what
